channel.title: Server wont take my new ip
channel.description: I got a server downloaded, and I wanted to change the ip. I went in my client then to my client.java ctrl f typed in there ip that it said it was trying to connect to in my source, found 2 area's where there ip was in switched it to 127.0.0.1, compiled both source and client.. I loaded the server back up, but my server says its still trying to connect to there ip? Why's that?

item.title: Server wont take my new ip
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

Vhenom:

Just go back to how you had your files originally, then look up “server =” without the quotation marks in client.java (client sided) and replace that with 127.0.0.1 compile and run the client. and you should be good

I had already done that man, I already did that. Then I tried to go into class and change it… Now I can’t even run it? lol Why would changing the ip to 127.0.0.1 in the client.class gui.class make run not work…

Read full topic
item.source: Server wont take my new ip

item.title: Server wont take my new ip
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

Vhenom:

Did you compile?

Yes, I used the filesearcher it had in the client, and typed in there ip and changed there ip that was in all the class and everything to 127.0.0.1, now the client opens for 1 second then closes… Why :S

Read full topic
